implementation.name: App
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Main UI component that manages the state and orchestrates all task operations (add, edit, delete, mark as completed/pending) by calling API methods and rendering TaskForm and TaskItem components.
implementation.pseudo_code:
On mount:
    Fetch all tasks from backend and store in state
When user clicks '+ Add Task':
    Open TaskForm for new task
When user submits TaskForm:
    If editingTask is set:
        Call handleUpdateTask
    Else:
        Call handleCreateTask
When user clicks Edit on a task:
    Set editingTask and open TaskForm
When user clicks Delete on a task:
    Call handleDeleteTask
When user toggles completion:
    Call handleToggleComplete
Render:
    TaskForm (modal) if isFormOpen
    List of TaskItem components for each filtered/sorted task

implementation.name: TaskForm
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: UI form for adding or editing a task. Collects title, description, priority, due date, and tag (category), and calls onSubmit with the task data.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Display form fields:
    Title (required)
    Description
    Priority (Low/Medium/High)
    Category (tag)
    Due Date
On submit:
    Validate required fields
    Call onSubmit with task data

implementation.name: TaskItem
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Displays a single task with buttons to edit, delete, and toggle completion. Calls parent handlers for these actions.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Render task details (title, description, priority, category, due date)
Show Edit, Delete, and Complete/Pending buttons
On Edit: call onEdit(task)
On Delete: call onDelete(task.id)
On Complete/Pending: call onToggleComplete(task)

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to fetch all tasks. Used by frontend to display the list of tasks.

implementation.name: create_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to add a new task. Receives all required fields and stores the new task.
implementation.pseudo_code:
@app.post('/tasks')
Receive TaskCreate object
Call database.add_task(task)
Return created task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to edit an existing task. Updates the task with new data.
implementation.pseudo_code:
@app.put('/tasks/{task_id}')
Receive TaskCreate object
Call database.update_task(task_id, task)
If not found, raise 404
Return updated task

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to delete a task by ID.
implementation.pseudo_code:
@app.delete('/tasks/{task_id}')
Call database.delete_task(task_id)
If not found, raise 404
Return success message

implementation.name: update_task (for completed/pending)
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Same as update_task endpoint; used by frontend to mark a task as completed or pending by updating the 'completed' field.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Frontend calls @app.put('/tasks/{task_id}')
Passes updated 'completed' status
Database updates the task

implementation.name: delete_task

get_tasks()
Remove task with matching id
If removed:

implementation.name: read_tasks

implementation.pseudo_code:
When a GET request is made to /tasks:
    Call get_tasks()
    Return the list of tasks

implementation.name: get_tasks
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Retrieves all tasks (events) from the database file. Called by the read_tasks endpoint.
implementation.pseudo_code:
If the database file does not exist:
    Return an empty list
Open the database file
Try to load JSON data
    For each item in data:
        Create a Task object
    Return the list of Task objects
If JSON decode fails:
    Return an empty list

implementation.name: create_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to add a new task (event). Entry point for event creation.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a POST request is made to /tasks with a TaskCreate payload:
    Call add_task(task)
    Return the created task

implementation.name: add_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Adds a new task (event) to the database. Called by the create_task endpoint.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Call get_tasks() to get current tasks
Create a new Task object with a unique id and data from TaskCreate
Append the new task to the list
Save the updated list to the database
Return the new task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to edit an existing task (event). Entry point for event editing.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a PUT request is made to /tasks/{task_id} with a TaskCreate payload:
    Call update_task(task_id, task)
    If no task is found:
        Raise 404 error
    Return the updated task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Updates an existing task (event) in the database. Called by the update_task endpoint.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Call get_tasks() to get current tasks
For each task in the list:
    If task.id matches task_id:
        Create updated Task object
        Replace the old task with the updated one
        Save the updated list to the database
        Return the updated task
If no match found:
    Return None

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to delete an existing task (event). Entry point for event deletion.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a DELETE request is made to /tasks/{task_id}:
    Call delete_task(task_id)
    If deletion fails:
        Raise 404 error
    Return success message

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Deletes a task (event) from the database. Called by the delete_task endpoint.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Call get_tasks() to get current tasks
Filter out the task with the given id
If a task was removed:
    Save the updated list to the database
    Return True
Else:
    Return False

missing_implementations: A new event must include a name, description, and location.
